conclusion: To determine the car's speed at the end of the 2nd second, we need to analyze the given x-t (position-time) graph.
The graph shows the position x of the car as a function of time t.
The y-axis represents x/t in meters per second (m/s), which is essentially the velocity.
The x-axis represents time t in seconds (s).
The graph shows a straight line, indicating constant velocity.
The line passes through the point (0, 10) and extends linearly.

premise: The slope of the line in an x-t graph represents the velocity.
conclusion: The line starts at t = -2 and x/t = 0, and goes through t = 0 and x/t = 10.

premise: The slope of the line in an x-t graph represents the velocity.
conclusion: The slope m of the line can be calculated using the formula: m = (10 - 0) / (0 - (-2)) = 10 / 2 = 5 m/s.

premise: The slope represents the constant velocity of the car.
conclusion: Since the velocity is constant, the speed at any time t is the same.

premise: Since the velocity is constant, the speed at any time t is the same.
conclusion: Therefore, the speed at the end of the 2nd second is 5 m/s.
